page.title: 06THE GLOVE FACTORY, WOODSTOCK
page.content: The glove industry in Woodstock was thought to have been started off when people shot animals in Blenheim Park and made gloves out of them. They made gloves out of the skins of deer, lambs, sheep and rabbits. The sheep skins now come from hot countries so they stretch more. There used to be five factories but now there is only one, which five people work in, whilst twenty-two people work at home. There are fourteen different processes for making the gloves. They cut thirty-six pairs a day. There are four different types of gloves and four sizes. Queen Elizabeth had some and Priness Diana had a pair for her wedding. The factory has been famous for four hundred years. They make hats, coats, hand bags, purses, shoes, slippers and belts as well.
